boardPhysics

Class Flipper

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardPhysics.Flipper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoardObject, Gadget

    public class Flipper
extends java.lang.Object
implements Gadget, BoardObject

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static double EPSILON
      Base error that is tolerable in angle
      protected physics.LineSegment flipper
      The line segment representing the flipper
      protected java.util.List<physics.Circle> flipperVertices
      The end points of the flipper
      protected int height
      The height of this gadget in units of L
      protected java.lang.String id
      The unique identifier of this wall
      protected boolean isLeft
      False if the flipper is a right flipper, True if it is a left flipper.
      protected boolean isRotating
      Boolean that denotes whether the flipper is in the process of rotating
      protected boolean isRotatingUp
      Boolean that denotes whether the flipper is in the process of rotating up if it is rotating
      protected double orientation
      Orientation of the flipper --> 0 if it is vertical, 90 if it is horizontal, and correspondingly in between
      protected double reflecCoeff
      The reflection coefficient for this gadget
      protected double rotationRate
      Angular velocity at which rotation occurs in degrees
      protected double rotationRateRad
      Angular velocity at which rotation occurs in radians
      protected java.util.List<Gadget> triggers
      List of gadgets whose triggers are connected to this gadget
      protected int width
      The width of this gadget in units of L
      protected int xCoord
      X coordinate of the upper left corner of this gadget
      protected int yCoord
      Y coordinate of the upper left corner of this gadget

      Progresses an object by a timestep assuming the current position and velocities of the object and assuming that *NO* collisions occur between that object and any other objects

      • impactCalc

        public double[] impactCalc(Ball ball)
        Description copied from interface: BoardObject
        Determine the time it will take until this object collides with a given ball and recalculate a ball's velocity assuming it collided with this board object
        Specified by:
        impactCalc in interface BoardObject
        Parameters:
        ball - a ball that collided with this board object
        Returns:
        a array of doubles with components: 0. Time until impact with the ball 1. x-component of the ball's new velocity post-impact 2. y-component of the ball's new velocity post-impact
